body:
Thanks for reporting, but hmm I cannot reproduce:

```console
ichard26@acer-ubuntu:~/programming/testing$ mkdir black1880
ichard26@acer-ubuntu:~/programming/testing$ cd black1880/
ichard26@acer-ubuntu:~/programming/testing/black1880$ python -m virtualenv env/
ichard26@acer-ubuntu:~/programming/testing/black1880$ actenv
(env) ichard26@acer-ubuntu:~/programming/testing/black1880$ pip install black==20.8b1
(env) ichard26@acer-ubuntu:~/programming/testing/black1880$ vim pyproject.toml
(env) ichard26@acer-ubuntu:~/programming/testing/black1880$ vim test.py
(env) ichard26@acer-ubuntu:~/programming/testing/black1880$ black test.py --check --diff -v
Using configuration from /home/ichard26/programming/testing/black1880/pyproject.toml.
test.py already well formatted, good job.
All done! ‚ú® üç∞ ‚ú®
1 file would be left unchanged.
(env) ichard26@acer-ubuntu:~/programming/testing/black1880$ cat pyproject.toml 
[tool.black]
target-version = ['py36']
line-length = 120
skip-string-normalization = true
exclude = '(.*/migrations/.*\.py)'
include = '.*/server/.*\.py$'
(env) ichard26@acer-ubuntu:~/programming/testing/black1880$ cat test.py
example = 'This is an example'
```

Hmm. I realize there's an implementation detail that mattered: the subdirectory we had the file in (server/) had a .git directory due to a docker quirk. Looking at find_pyproject_toml() and testing by removing the .git directory, it looks like black looks at the lowest directory with a .git and then uses that as the "root"?

new way to repro:

same files you had before, then do (in your test dir)

```mkdir subdir; mkdir subdir/.git/; mv test.py subdir/; black subdir/test.py --check --diff```

This is documented here: https://black.readthedocs.io/en/stable/pyproject_toml.html, so technically not an issue.

Yeah, it's intended behaviour to first look in the common parent directory of the discovered or/and passed-in files for a "project root" indicator. Although, I'll admit it isn't exactly clear at first glance, even with `--verbose`. Perhaps it would be helpful to have Black print what folder it determined as the project root when verbose output is enabled? (I know that the root of the filesystem fallback doesn't really count as the root of any project but we can bikeshed over that later)
+1 more debug info. We can close this as "user shouldn't code after 6pm"

Got a file:
```
$ cat blacktest.py
example = 'This is an example'


def func():
    '''this is a docstring'''
    pass


def func2():
    '''
    this is a docstring
    '''
    pass
```

When run with black==19.10b and `skip-string-normalization = true` in pyproject.toml, nothing happens.

When I do the same with latest black (20.8b1) I get:
```
$ black blacktest.py --check --diff
would reformat blacktest.py
Oh no! üí• üíî üí•
1 file would be reformatted.
--- blacktest.py	2021-02-20 01:44:06.141640 +0000
+++ blacktest.py	2021-02-20 01:47:05.430516 +0000
@@ -5,9 +5,9 @@
     '''this is a docstring'''
     pass


 def func2():
-    '''
+    """
     this is a docstring
-    '''
+    """
     pass
```

I.e. it does seem like black 20.8b1 _is_ indeed converting single-quote docstrings into double-quote docstrings, at least when the docstring starts with a newline.

Should that still be considered a bug, or what do you think @ichard26 ?

@tomage yeah that would be considered a bug. Fortunately that's been reported and fixed already (see [commit](https://github.com/psf/black/commit/7fe19fac5bccc08dbcf21c293ab50f1fcda7716f), [PR](https://github.com/psf/black/pull/1637), and [issue](https://github.com/psf/black/issues/1634)). Unfortunately the fix hasn't been shipped in a release yet.
Ah - dang - should have noticed that one! Thanks for the update!
Going to rename this issue to reflect @ichard26's suggestion that `--verbose` should print more information.

rename.to: `--verbose` mode should print location of project root

body: Had my eyes on implementing this. The core issue seems to be getting `verbose` and `find_project_root` to communicate, because parsing the configuration is done in the option declaration rather than in the main CLI function. Just to steer the implementation: would you prefer moving parsing the configuration inside main from the option declaration, *or* set some global state that is then read in main for verbose printing?

issue.title: Enhance `--verbose`
issue.body:
### Description

Black would now echo the location that it determined as the root path for the project if `--verbose` is enabled by the user, according to which it chooses the SRC paths, i.e. the absolute path of the project: `{root}/{src}`.

![Screenshot from 2021-10-07 13-40-59](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69356296/136345712-5d94d1ff-fd22-4c85-a49a-333a4c74429c.png)


Closes #1880
